duties_responsibilities.duty: Evaluate and implement changes to existing accounting methods for a more efficient system
Manage Accounts Payable, including bills, vendor payments, employee expenses, and client reimbursable expenses
Manage Accounts Receivable, including sending client invoices, reconciling budgets, tracking payments, and conducting A/R follow-ups
Manage bank and business credit accounts, as well as employee credit cards
Maintain subsidiary accounts via QuickBooks, including verifying, allocating, and posting transactions
Oversee and maintain general ledger and company P&L
Assist with financial planning & analysis, including budgetary planning, tracking, and forecasting
Prepare financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing company and/or client information
Comply with all federal, state, and local legal requirements by enforcing adherence, filing reports, and advising executives

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s or Associate's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration (Master's preferred)
